title: 111_hr3901
content: The "Homebuyer Tax Credit Improvement Act of 2009" enhances the administration of the first-time homebuyer tax credit. The "Homebuyer Tax Credit Improvement Act of 2009" amends the age limitation for the tax credit, requiring taxpayers to be at least 18 years old at the time of purchasing a residence. Married taxpayers can meet this requirement if either spouse is of the required age. The tax code amendments include documentation requirements for the first-time homebuyer tax credit and restrictions on married individuals acquiring a residence from the family of their spouse. Additionally, errors related to the tax credit are treated as mathematical or clerical errors. The tax code amendments include new documentation requirements for claiming the first-time homebuyer tax credit under section 36, including conditions related to age eligibility and consistency of information provided on income tax returns. The amendments made by this section apply to purchases after the enactment date, with documentation requirements for returns ending after the enactment date. Amendments for returns ending on or after April 9, 2008, are treated as mathematical and clerical errors. SEC. 3. Certain tax return preparers required to file returns electronically. SEC. 3. Certain tax return preparers required to file returns electronically. Subsection (e) of section 6011 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to require individual income tax returns prepared by tax return preparers to be filed on magnetic media if the preparer is specified for that calendar year. The amendment requires tax return preparers to file individual income tax returns electronically if they expect to file more than 100 returns in a calendar year. The effective date for this change is after December 31, 2010.
